There is also easy access for the major local towns, including Oxford, Reading and Newbury, the M4 and M40 motorways, and for Heathrow. <PARA> Recognised as a thriving community, there are a wide range of clubs, societies and special interest groups to suit most people. <PARA> There is a highly rated Primary school and in the local area are a first-class choice of both state and private schools with bus collections. <PARA> The central part of Goring is a ‘Conservation Area’ and has a wealth of interesting period properties many Listed being of significant architectural and historical interest. <PARA> Streatley on Thames, situated on the opposite Berkshire side of the river, is another pretty village surrounded by hills and woodlands now mainly owned by the National Trust. Fronting onto the river by the bridge crossing over to Goring is the luxury 4 star riverside hotel The Swan, renowned for its fine cuisine and leisure and fitness facilities. <PARA> Chiltern Court is a relatively new signature development of 10 luxury apartments built by Cantay Homes in 2008 of contemporary design and build affording high quality and stylish fixtures and fittings. <PARA> The development is conveniently located within the village, easily accessible for the central High Street shops and local amenities, scenic riverside and mainline station providing direct access to London Paddington in under the hour. <PARA> Flat 3 Chiltern Court occupies a quiet First Floor position and boasts an array of impressive feature as follows; <PARA> • Traditional cavity wall construction <PARA> • High levels of insulation <PARA> • Quality primary double glazed windows with security locks and stone sills <PARA> • White panelled interior doors having chrome furniture with carved door architraves, motifs and matching skirting boards <PARA> • Mains operated smoke detectors <PARA> • Energy efficient heating system with independent thermostatic controls <PARA> • Generous supply of power sockets provided with brushed chrome fittings <PARA> • A combination of inset, down-lighters, and up-lighter lighting <PARA> • TV points and BT points in Kitchen / Living room and bedrooms <PARA> The apartment offers luxury versatile open plan living within a traditionally crafted exterior, affording accommodation with a spacious reception hall, ample storage, a kitchen / sitting room, 2 double bedrooms, 1 with an en-suite bathroom, a separate shower room, and gas central heating. <PARA> OUTSIDE <PARA> The overall development is fully enclosed and sheltered by lap larch fencing and a mixture of newly planted hedging and trees combined with existing foliage. <PARA> The hedge lined private entrance leads to the side and rear car parking areas and the main communal entrance to the apartments. <PARA> West and east of the development you’ll find communal landscaped gardens which are maintained by the management company. A discreet cycle store will be found to the rear of the parking areas. <PARA> GENERAL SERVICES <PARA> Services: Mains electricity, water and drainage are connected to the property. Central Heating and Hot Water from mains gas fired boiler. <PARA> Council Tax: D <PARA> Postcode: RG8 0BH <PARA> Energy Efficiency Rating: B <PARA> Holding Deposit Equal to 1 Weeks Rent = £288.46 <PARA> Deposit Held Against Damages Equal to 5 Weeks Rent = £1442.30 <PARA> Local Authority: South Oxfordshire District Council - Telephone: <PARA> DIRECTIONS <PARA> From our offices in the centre of Goring proceed up the High Street turning left at the railway bridge. Head along Wallingford road for a further 400 metres or so, and Chiltern Court can be found just off on the right hand side after having passed by Westholme Stores. <PARA> VIEWING <PARA> Strictly by appointment through Warmingham & Co <PARA> DISCLAIMER <PARA> N.B. The agent has not tested any apparatus, equipment, fittings or services so cannot verify that they are in working order. If required, the client is advised to obtain verification. Large industrial-style windows flood the space with natural light, highlighting exposed textures and enhancing the sense of volume and openness. A dining area is seamlessly integrated into the layout, while a statement patterned rug, floating timber shelves, curated artwork and ambient lighting subtly define areas for relaxing and dining without interrupting the cohesive open-plan design. The modern kitchen blends effortlessly into the space and features sleek cabinetry, rich wooden worktops, open shelving and contemporary appliances including a built-in oven, hob, fridge and modern sink fittings. Reclaimed-style wood panelling, minimalist metal accents and carefully considered detailing reinforce the architectural warehouse-loft aesthetic, while indoor plants and curated décor add warmth and character. <PARA> Neighbourhood <PARA> Borough and Bankside are among London’s most architecturally and culturally rich neighbourhoods. Just moments away, Borough Market offers artisan produce and renowned street food, while the South Bank is home to iconic landmarks including Tate Modern, Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre and the Millennium Bridge leading to St Paul’s Cathedral. The River Thames provides scenic walking routes framed by some of London’s most celebrated modern and historic architecture, including The Shard with its panoramic city views. The area is celebrated for its exceptional dining scene, with restaurants such as Padella, Flat Iron Square and Hawksmoor Borough, alongside historic pubs including The Anchor Bankside and The George Inn. <PARA> Transport connections are excellent. Borough station serves the Northern line for convenient access to the West End and King’s Cross.
